thread.title: Clad in orange robe, PM Modi meditates at Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari | See first photos - India
thread.title_full: Clad in orange robe, PM Modi meditates at Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari | See first photos - India News | The Financial Express

author: India News Desk
title: Clad in orange robe, PM Modi meditates at Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari | See first photos - India
text:
The first visuals of Prime Minister Narendra Modi meditating in Kanyakumari showed the BJP leader in front of a statue of philosopher-saint Swami Vivekananda. PM Modi will meditate at the Vivekananda Rock memorial till Saturday evening.
PM Modi meditates at the Dhyan Mandapam. (Image: X/@BJP4India) Winding up a gruelling two-month-long campaigning for the Lok Sabha elections, PM Modi went into a 45-hour meditation on Thursday.
Also Read: As PM Modi meditates in Kanyakumari, a decades-old photo from Vivekananda Rock Memorial surfaces
India’s sunrise pic.twitter.com/UnyWdtgadJ
— BJP (@BJP4India) May 31, 2024 Clad in an orange attire, PM Modi can be seen meditating as the first rays of sun hit the earth.
When spirituality is your strength… pic.twitter.com/Pn6MKbuDi7
— BJP (@BJP4India) May 31, 2024 The Prime Minister is meditating at the Dhyan Mandapam, the same spot where Swami Vivekananda had meditated in 1892 to get a clear vision of the future of India.
The Rock Memorial is situated at the meeting point of the Indian Ocean, Bay of Bengal and the Arabian Sea.
(Image Credits: X/@BJP4India) The PM arrived in Kanyakumari on Thursday evening and is likely to leave for Delhi on June 1.
Also Read: PM Modi arrives in Kanyakumari, to embark on 2-day ‘dhyan’ at Vivekananda Rock Memorial shortly
Ahead of the 2019 Lok Sabha election results, PM Modi had embarked on a similar spiritual journey in Uttarakhand. Back then, he was also photographed meditating in a holy cave near Kedarnath.
